description:
The dinner Lomo Saltado was excellent - strips of beef sautéed with onions, tomatoes, and special herbs. The flavor was masterful! Yum!! Interestingly, the mixture included a few French fries embedded in the sauce. The sauce was superb.

Mi Lindo Peru offers the same tasty mixture of herbs, onions, tomatoes with chicken or seafood. I think I will try the chicken next time (Saltado de Pollo). The chicken is dark meat and I prefer that to white meat.

The dinner portion was substantial; actually, more than I could eat. Oh, and the Lomo Saltado includes a large serving of rice. At lunch the portions and price are smaller. 

The waiter and other employees were so very friendly and helpful. I had not been to a Peruvian food restaurant so I needed advice. The waiter was superb, cordial, and helpful. 

Mi Lindo Peru is smallish in size and not fancy, but that is fine with me. I like this place.

Parking is street metered, I think. I took public transportation.
author: Robert H.

description:
Our very close friend took us here for dinner and boy were we impressed. Every dish we had was authentic tasting. 

We started with bread and yucca fries. The bread came with this spicy dipping sauce that was delicious. And the sauce that came with the yucca fries were addicting. It was rich and creamy but also had a kick. We then had the beef hearts and papa rellenas. The papa rellenas were stuffed with meat and olives. The stuffing was tasty and they definitely did not skimp on that. The green chicken soup was amazing. Don't forget to squeeze the lime. The loma soltado was good and the fish ceviche was super fresh. 

Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Windy M.

description:
A bit of a hike from the BART station, but totally worth the trek.  So many good things on the menu that you can diversify beyond the standard lomo saltado.  Seriously, everything was just bursting with flavor!

Bread, Butter & Salsa: This was different.  Soft bread, soft butter and salsa.  But the salsa was heavy on the onions and cumin, so more like chutney.  Anyway, it was surprisingly delicious.  Had to pace myself to save room for the food I was actually paying for.

Chicharron Al Ajo: These was AMAZING!  Every bit of chicken had a super crispy exterior.  The cuts were a little odd with a bunch of bones, but maybe that kinda small piece big surface area technique is what enables it to be so crispy.  There was an enormous amount of fried garlic on topic, which made it delicious.  A nice dip of lemon juice and oil to add a counterbalancing tang.

Lomo Saltado: This is typically my favorite Peruvian dish, so I've tried a ton of variations over the years.  They don't get fancy with big chunks of filet mignon.  Just respectable strips of nondescript beef that one would see in a stir fry dish.  I liked that they cut the tomatoes into a similarly manageable shape.  Swimming in its soy based marinade, so lots to flavor the rice with.  The french fries were nice and crispy, but not overly so.

Maracuya: I love passionfruit so I was all about this drink.  Very refreshing paired against all the rich deep fried stuff.
author: Adam B.

description:
The food taste amazing & the service is incredible. I enjoy coming to this place for the past 5 years.
Never fails
author: Kelly M.

description: Undecided what to have for dinner, we found parking and walked out way here! Well we didn't regret it. Very, very nice and friendly service. Some of the best sangria I've had in a long time. The champiñones en ají were so good! The Gambas al Ajillo same!! My daughter had the ají al Aji de Gallina which she enjoyed. Our friend had the Lomo Saltado, also great!!!
author: Adi A.

description: If you are looking for authentic Peruvian food, look no further! This place is as close as it comes to when compared to my grandfather's cooking. There has never been a dish that myself or anyone in my family has ordered and didn't like. From the lomo saltado (marinated steak, onions, fries, all served with rice, to the anticuchos (marinated beef heart), everything has so much flavor and is cooked just right! If you have never tried Peruvian cuisine and are looking to be adventurous I would highly recommend coming here.
author: Franchesca B.

description: i had the lomo saltado and it was absolutely delicious! all the french fries were cooked perfectly and everything was very tasty. i'd definitely come back!
author: Chris S.

description: I've been coming here for years, the first time I came here I fell in love with their delicious Lomo saltado, it's one of my favorite things to order from their menu. The staff is really friendly and very patient. Their salsa that comes with the bread is over the top.
author: Bella D.

description:
Ufffff, this place is delicious. Walked in here after trying to find a quick nearby lunch spot and I'm so glad I found it. Neighborhood is a little questionable but nothing too crazy. Mission be like that sometimes.

Place is small but the service is on point and the food comes out QUICK. So many great things to choose from on the menu and I will be returning to try more. That said, their churrasco is amazing, their gallina dish is super tasty, and their lomo saltado divine. Nice touch with the warm bread and butter. Huge portions and great prices. Love Mi Lindo Peru! I will be back!
author: Joanna R.

description:
Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3/5
Overall: ok food at a good price.  Can't complain about the portion size.  

The extended review...

Food: 

Mar y Tierra - really can't complain about the portion size of the food.  The steak was a little bit dry.  The shrimp was definitely better.  The good thing is that I didn't leave the place hungry.

Service: in all the times I've come here the service has been great.  Friendly and attentive staff.

Ambiance: just a slight step up from a hole in the wall.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
I can't even tell you how disappointed I was in the food here. First let me state the service is extremely friendly and efficient, so no problems there. Everything was run like a well oiled machine.

Now to the food. First, they give you bread to start with, but I feel like it didn't really mesh well with the menu. Maybe a different type of bread would work better? Or plantain chips? It's nice that they give it, but I didn't feel like I could eat it with anything we ordered, that's all. We started off with the fish ceviche and while the quality of fish was great, the juice was from lemons, not limes. This may not seem like a big deal, but it is. Oh it is!!! And I didn't like it. Not one bit. I also don't think it was fresh lemon juice. It seemed like it came from those lemon squeeze bottles, so if that doesn't sound appealing to you don't order the ceviche. 

Next we ordered the grilled beef hearts (not my idea. I wanted causa), and I was not a fan, but I don't think it's because they did anything wrong. I just don't like consuming that particular organ. Moving on, we ordered the lomo saltado for the main and it was just ok. I really like the fresh cut fries and might order it again if I found myself here, but I'm in NO rush to come back. If I go to a Peruvian place I'm mostly judging them on their ceviche, and they missed the mark completely. If they begin to use lime juice then maybe we can talk....
author: Steph L.

description: Causa is deliciuos.. and lomo pobre  is huge plate .. for share minimum 2 .. very peruan  restaurant.
author: Leonardo T.

description:
My go-to spot for great Peruvian food and decent portions for reasonable prices! They also give complimentary bread with salsa and butter. 

Very attentive, welcoming service - always refilling our water. Feels very homey. 

If you're looking for authentic, delicious Peruvian food in SF, you'll find it here!
author: Gee B.

description:
From the moment we opened the door, the aroma of the food sits you DOWN. Despite that day being cash only, praise for the BOA, we ensured to have enough for our meals.

My meal - ensalada con camarón with avocado ($2xtra) and WORTH IT. 
They give bread with AMAZING salsa-like sauce to dip.
So good! But be aware it is on pricey side $$$
author: Albia C.

description:
Wow!  The food here is excellent, the service is good, and these setting is pleasant and welcoming.

My husband and I shared two dishes:

1) Saltado de pollo - amazing!  Packed with flavor - I absolutely loved this dish
2) Arroz con pollo - also excellent!

The dishes were generously sized, and we left with enough leftovers for a full meal for one.

The complimentary bread, butter, and salsa were also great!  

The service was pleasant and reasonably efficient.  They didn't check on us after we got our food, which was the only negative. 

The setting was warm and welcoming, and the decor was neat.

Overall, this is a wonderful spot for a casual meal, and I look forward to returning!
author: Barnali D.

description:
After trolling through the dusty Blue grass fest in Golden Gate Park, my friends and I decided to find a low key Peruvian restaurant for dinner last night. Initially Yelp gave a lot of options for Peruvian ....... but my friends recommended this place. A small, nice, hut like place. Nothing fancy....... However, it is very clean and managed by two proactive people.

Like any other table, we started with complimentary bread and Salsa Criolla, this is a Peruvian version of Onion-Chili Relish..... and I must say, it was a surprise for me! It had a perfect kick of salt, acid and spice. Onion pieces added a nice crunch punch in each bite.

Heart meat tapas skewers were over the top. We ordered two servings of it and cleaned our plates fast. My friends caught me saving the last piece for my last bite.

Yuca fries with sauce was decent and ceviche was over the hook! The perfect mish mash of tangy fresh fish meat topped with sweet vinegary red onions.

Interestingly their steak was drenched with a secret sauce, which made us curious to ask the lady about it.

The server instinctively realized how much I love sauce and generously served their special spicy house sauce which was damn hot with beautiful sweet habanero aroma to it.

Definitely take your foodie friends here. They will love it!
author: Silvia R.

description:
It has been years since the last time I was here. I made sure I visited this amazing place this time in SF.  I have NEVER been disappointed with anything here. The only downfall, you can't control the noise level but with the amazing food- it goes away. LOL. 

Food is amazing- pick anything off the menu its going to be great.  Service- love the waiter, he's been around for awhile and always has smile on his face. Portions are generous and price matches what you get.  YUM YUM YUM.  I can't say it enough. I LOVE this place.
author: Regeena E.

description:
Came here for my wife's birthday. Heard nothing but great things about this restaurant and since she's Peruvian why not try a little taste of home. We started off with a few great appetizers had the gambas ají which are essentially garlic prawns. Delicious. Papa la huancaina. Also tasty. We both ordered the lomo saltadado. To our surprise it wasn't as great but edible. Lacking flavor. To top it all off we ordered this "Paella" which was anything but that. The rice was lumpy and cold. The seafood over cooked. And overall lacking flavor. Besides everything else this was the only issue we had and when we brought it up to the server in charge she informed us that we " had already ordered it therefore we had to eat it" we tried to argue that we weren't going to pay for something we didn't eat and she offered us a box to take it home. Talk about great customer service. We paid for the meal in full rather then argue and gave her the whole dish and asked her to dispose of it whatever way she felt. Promise to never return to this horrible customer service lacking establishment ever again. My 2 cents. Enjoy. 
PS. The one star I'm giving them is for the Inca Kola I had it was delicious and Ice cold. Thank you.
author: Abel R.

description:
This review was due 6 months ago. Sorry!

Omg! This is definitely one of my favorite places. Food was amazing. Very tasty and big portions. 

Walked in and was seated right away. Friendly staff and very helpful. 

I ordered the pollo al oreganato. It was very delicious. Just the right spices and the chicken was fully cooked.

My friend ordered the bisteck a la chorillana. She said is was tender and very tasty. 

We also ordered the platano Frito. Yumm! I would have like it if they were crispier but it was still very good. 

For desert, we shared the flan. Not too sweet. Just right. 

Definitely will be going back.
author: Nerissa D.

description:
Haven't been able to explore the menu and try something different but of all the times I've eaten here I always order "Saltado de Pollo".....mmm scrumptious...tasty. Oh hell, it's that damn good. 

The team here are very friendly and the restaurant is always clean. You can tell the team really cares about the cleanliness and making sure their customers are satisfied. 

I have only ate here during lunch hours which happens to get filled with staff members from St Luke's hospital. Not to forget everyone else that comes in to enjoy good food. 

I would love to have dinner here but maybe that will be a date night with the hubby.
author: Lady L.

description: ¡Ayyy sííí! I love lomo saltado, and theirs is really solid. I added an egg to the seemingly already perfect combination of three types of onions, tomatoes, beef, fries, rice, and corn. If the egg were a bit more crispy around the edges, I'd be even happier, but I give this classic, non-bougie meal a five. $13-something during lunch, with egg added.
author: Paulina F.

description:
First off ... I love Peruvian food!

The staff was genuinely friendly and greeted me and my colleague upon entering. 

Our Order:
Arroz Con Mariscos
-Maracuya to drink
Saltado De Camarones 
-Maracuya to drink

The food here is good! The Paella was missing a little something ... I added a little salt and pepper and made it better.
author: Jason Ray P.

description:
This is probably the best place to have Peruvian like mom made at home! You can go to other places that serve Peruvian but you will not have anything better than Mi Lindo Peru! Ive been coming to this place for the last 15 years, I think! I never get tired of  the food. I've dined at other Peruvian places and had breakfast, lunch and dinner in Peru, none I've had comes close to the price and flavor as Mi Lindo!

The staff is the best! Portions are huge! Talk about getting your money's worth! 
Don't take my word just try it and you'll be hooked like I was!

I've recommended so many people here, none has ever said the food was ok! They've always said it great! 

Staff is always welcoming and have great suggestions on what to order. 

Thanks Carlos and staff!!!

Dennis
author: D C.

description: We've lived in the area for over 10 years. Mi Lindo Peru was one of the first restaurants we went to when we got here, and we've gone back countless times over the past decade. The food is delicious, comforting, and there's something for everyone. There's plenty of vegetarian options (for me), and plenty of meat options (for husband). It's a great value. Of course, the service matches the food. Everyone is so friendly. They remember our regular order, and welcome you like family. I have loved having this place as part of our neighborhood.
author: Eileen N.

description: Que Paso? I am beyond dissappointed at the food. I order a Peruvian tamal .... it was anything but !!!I ya no vengo la comida nada que veer.
author: Paola M.

description: The aji de gallina and ceviche are favorites of my partner and I--wonderful especially on one of our chilly SF evenings.
author: Adam C.

description: I came here for a company's staff lunch and tried peruvian food for the first time. I'm glad I came with colleagues as I didn't know what's good. We shared a lot of appetizers and it was all yummy. I ate a seafood paella and it was delicious.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Best Peruvian for vegetarians in the bay. I love this place. Been going for at least 10 years and they never fail.
author: J_ V.

description: this place is so cute and made me feel like I was in Peru. I loved the service and how they were able to help me since I don't speak a lick of Spanish.
author: Megan T.

description: Wow the food here is delicious and tastes like real home cooking. We had the vegetarian lomo Saltado and the fish of the day along with a couple of appetizers everything was delicious service was great. My friend who is Peruvian says that this is authentic
author: Maria R.

description:
I've been here twice and it never seems to disappoint me . Lomo saltado is the best plate in my opinion. The drinks they have a bomb dot com 
& the people there are so humble & nice 
Great place
author: Victoria F.

description:
The spicy sauce goes with the butter and bread, yes that is correct.  It looks like a little bowl of water salsa but it really is just a bowl of yummy sauce!  But yes our server said the way to eat it is on a small piece of bread with butter and some sauce.  But I could use that sauce (and I did) on everything! Warning, it is spicy, but it is so flavorful.

Ordered three dishes to try

Arroz com Pollo ($14.95): it's like a seasoned fried rice (nothing like Chinese fried rice though) with a side of onions/tomatoes.  Seasoned heavily in cilantro sauce.  Huge chunks of chicken breast and insanely seasoned rice.  I did like a little yummy spicy sauce on it to give it a little kick.

Aji de gallina: ($14.95): Shredded chicken and potatoes in a yellow curry sauce and a few slices of hard boiled egg.  Really good flavor but I think I'm not a huge fan of shredded chicken.  It's supposed to be spicy but I ordered it medium - I think that was a mistake, it could use some spice.  Comes with a heap of well-cooked rice.

Pescado Saltado ($18.95): Sauteed red snapper with onions, tomatoes and potatoes (but really it seems like it's sauteed with french fries!).  Really flavorful and yes comes with a heap of rice too

It's a little expensive with all main dishes seeming to be between $15 to $20.  But to be fair, portions are huge and we left with tons of leftovers that I'm excited to eat (of course got to-go containers of the spicy sauce too).  If it weren't so expensive I think I'd give it 5-stars but only 4 because even with the huge portions, I'm not convinced I feel like it's fully up to the value.

It seems like they took reservations for large parties; we just walked in for two.

Single bathroom

Takes VISA and MC.

Parking is often easier on Valencia or behind (e.g., Mission and San Jose sometimes are tough to park on)

I will definitely be back to try some of the other yummy options here.
author: Traci H.

description: Awesome food and especially the sangria!  Can't go wrong with any order.  Lots of selections from chicken to seafood.  Loma Saltado, Paella, Ceviche and the seafood soup are my favorites.
author: Anne H.

description: The vegeterian options are great. I thought their chicha morada was too sweet (maybe geared towards folks with a sweet tooth). The service was great and the portions will leave you with a Buddha belly.
author: Beerus S.

description: The service and food was awesome my new favorite place when vist san francisco. Order garlic chicken it was awesome.
author: Rachel R.

description: This was my first experience with Peruvian food, and I did not leave disappointed. The food portions are massive, so come hungry. It was a very delicious and unique experience.
author: Adam S.

description: Wow. Finally went to Mi Lindo Peru after being recommended this restaurant sometime ago. Definitely lived up to expectations. The lomo saltado and camarones saltado we're both amazing as well as the ceviche de mariscos. Service was great and felt really at home here. Will 100% Be returning and soon.
author: Matthew C.

description: This used to be my favorite restaurant, and not just my favorite Peruvian restaurant but my favorite restaurant of all. Sadly, they have changed their food. They still serve the same menu items but they have changed their ingredients or chef or both? I believe it changed about 3 1/2 years ago. I went in and had my favorite papa a la huancaina but it just wanted good and the sauce tasted totally different. I was disappointed. Usually this sauce is the best thing ever to me and I can put it on everything, it was so good before that I could literally eat the sauce by itself, it was amazing. Now I can't even eat the sauce. It's been 3 years now so I thought maybe I would give them another chance and see if the food is back up to par but it is not. I went a free days ago and got a side of huancaina sauce. It doesn't even taste like huancaina sauce and it totally different, I'm so sad because I dream of their old huancaina sauce and now I can never have it again and will have to get it from other Peruvian places. I also got the lomo saltado which also has changed in flavor etc but it was still good, but not as good as it once was and that is why I am giving 3 stars because some things are still good. The ceviche also used to be good but when I got it 3 years ago it was bad, could have been a bad day though. As always the chica morada drink is good and of course inca cola.
author: Barbara C.

description: Came here for holiday dinner and it did not disappoint. I have a Peruvian lady friend who cooks lunch for us when we are in Marin and this restaurants Lomo Saltado and Ceviche are on point. Their Sangria is que rico too. Worth the whole looking for parking experience because youre in the Mish...go check them out. Very pleasant employees too.
author: Em B.

description: Great taste, more like home style food, good service, but they can improve a little bit, first causa de pollo, the chicken with a touch of celery and the home Mayo was really tasty, but the mashed potato wasn't bad but the texture is no the proper, the lomo saltado was really tasty but like a said is more like home style, no like restaurant with the little smoky flavor, third the jalea was ok but the golf sauce made this dish great, the chicha morada was ok.
author: Mauricio A.

description:
I was excited about going to a Peruvian Spot especially since my partner saw it on yelp and state it was 4 stars!

Staff was very friendly and welcoming, also helpful in the ordering process with recommendations. The location was close to where I was working for the day, atmosphere was nice!

The food was ok.. honestly it was a little bland, mainly the Saltado De Camarones.. I had to add some seasoning to it, but once that was done it gave it some flavor. 

The Passionfruit was absolutely delicious I'd most certainly order that if I ever visited again.
author: Takara U.

description:
I expected the food to be cheaper. ~$20/entree is kind of ridiculous for a place like this. Don't get me started on how much less it would cost in LA.

Anyway, after much debate, we decided on Arroz Con Pollo and Pescado Al Ajo. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of of the entrees. There was no way we could finish them. We expected the Arroz Con Pollo to be the star but the Pescado really outshined the Arroz. The fish was fried and served with fried garlic and rice. It doesn't sound healthy and it was probably cooked with a stick of butter but it sure was delicious! If I ever come back, I would get it again.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Amazing Peruvian cuisine. We had the pollo saltado and pescado saltado, both amazing and good portion sizes. Highly recommend asking for extra salsa (caution, super spicy) to add to the rice!  The sangria is also amazing and great to share a liter... or two.

If you're up for dessert get the lúcuma helado, trust me, you won't be disappointed!
author: Matt B.

description:
We came here with a party of 9 (we made reservations) and had a great experience. The service was friendly and attentive. We were served bread with butter and a bowl of their salsa which you eat with the bread. It was good and kept us munching away until our plates arrived. We ordered a lot entrees. From the appetizers, entrées to desserts. 
Appetizers 
1. Calamari: delicious, crispy and served with their special sauce and side of onions. The onions were served perfectly because they were marinated so that it kept the onion flavor but took away the onion aftertaste and lingering effects of onion breath, perfect!
2. Cerviche: must get, it's refreshing and packed with flavor.
3. Papas: the sauce though, so subtle yet it complemented the soft potatoes.
Entrées 
1. Steak and chicken saltados: both cooked with herbs and seasoned nicely that didn't take away from the rice and fries and the meats were tender.
2. Bisteck a lo pobre: fried plantains with steak, rice and fried egg, the flavors mixed well and I could have finished the plate to myself if we weren't all sharing. 
Dessert: platano frito con helado de lucuma, yes yes yes! The best way to finish off all that food. Drizzled in a little bit of chocolate, creamy and satisfying. 
I absolutely loved checking off another bookmark that did not disappoint.
author: Stacey K.

description: Very tasty and original food, fresh and service was friendly and fast. Full Bar. Reasonably priced. This is my favorite of two I've tried in the area. I've eaten here for lunch and dinner. Fairly quiet and not too crowded; ample seating. If you're tired of the usual Mexican fare of tacos and burritos, this is the best Hispanic alternative. Parking is moderately difficult in this side of Mission Street, but the Mission bus is an easy alternative. Moderate portions. Try the side plates/tapas for dinner.
author: Albert K.

description: Had the platanos & chicken lomo saltado to go. Good phone service & the food was done in time. Portions were a good size. A little pricey. $23 for just those 2 things. Textures were good but could have used a little bit more flavor for the lomo saltado. Looked clean when I went inside to get the food. Wanna go back & try some more dishes!
author: Carmen A.

description: This review is long overdue.  I've been going to this restaurant for over 20 years.  This is my family's favorite Peruvian restaurant.  We love the chicharron de pollo, chiccarron de calamares, lomo or de pollo saltado, mar y Tierra, pescado al ajo, en salada mixta and sopa a la criolla.  All dishes are tasty and exploding with flavor.  My girls are super picky eaters, but not here!  My oldest daughter says this is her favorite restaurant.  The owner, Carlos and his staff are a class act!   They treat you like family!
author: Nate C.

description: Awesome food got there the waitress he was really nice even gave my son his own plate :) shape like a little cow and the food did not take long and it tasted great best Peruvian place also the portions are great
author: Carmen R.

description:
Great food! Awesome savory lomo saltado and papa a la huancaina! 
Great Peruvian food with lots of flavor-  I would recommend these two plates, made with potatoes and beef strips.

Environment is friendly and peaceful decor.  Had great service:)
author: Jenna E.

description: Best food in town ! (I'm aware of how bias my comment is, but I really love this place !)
author: Gretchen R.

description:
My friend considers this place his favorite for Peruvian cuisine. Limon is a favorite of mine, but I decided to give this place a shot since he spoke so highly of it.

We didn't get the usual complimentary bread with butter and salsa de rocoto (hot pepper sauce) like everyone else. Maybe they ran out?

Instead we got their spicy salsa and a handful of CANCHA http://bit.ly/16I8yDf.
These toasted corn kernals are usually served alongside ceviche, but it's also great for snacking by itself. 
- It's hollow so they shatter in your mouth, rather then crunching. I can see why these tasty corn nuts are popular in Peru. They're quite addictive.

CEVICHE DE MARISCOS ($16.95): 
http://bit.ly/1AOpUrq
Soft red snapper, mussels, calamari, and prawns are marinated with fresh lime juice. 
- The fork-tender pieces of sweet daikon and carrots were a nice balance to the acidic citrus juice. There was even a nice sprinkling of that cancha, yum! 
I would definitely order this again.

LOMO SALTADO ($14.95): 
http://bit.ly/1JH2f1S
Lean strips of beef sauteed w/onions, french fries and tomatoes. It was okay. Not as flavorful and sauced up like the one I had at Limon's.

BISTECK A LO POBRE ($16.95):
http://bit.ly/13TQZz2
A traditional dish consisting of a grilled steak accompanied by fried potatoes, sauteed onions, topped with a fried egg.
- Instead of the fries, Mi Lindo Peru serves theirs with 2 small pieces of plantains. 
- Also the steak resembled a hamburger patty more than an actual steak, but it was nicely cooked and juicy. 
- The egg yolk and extra sauce from the pan jus makes this dish even more wonderful.

CHICHARRON DE POLLO ($9.95):
http://bit.ly/1CsN8nX
Menu said "breaded pieces of deep fried chicken served with fresh lemon juice and spices."
- We got drummettes (I counted 6 or 7) that were unseasoned and rather small for $10. I was expecting something more like the entire fried chicken from Limon. 
- The dipping sauce was basically lemon juice dusted w/salt and pepper. Meh. 

Overall, a nice meal with friendly service. I'll probably revisit here when I'm back in town again.
author: Cin T.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant. No, seriously, my whole family loves this place. The food is delicious, the portions are great especially when I can take them for lunch the next day, and while the location can make parking frustrating, it is worth it. 

If you've never had Peruvian food and want to try it, go to Mi Lindo Peru. You won't be disappointed!
author: Brenda M.

description: Service was excellent, friendly, and prompt. The downside is that I found the menu to be pricey, specially the ceviche, it has a more cafeteria feel to it rather than a restaurant. I tried the fried chicken pieces and they were overcooked. The yuca and sauce was fine. My friends had shrimp and a veggie plate and they weren't thrilled by it neither.
author: Lorely G.

description: The food is so authentic and delicious!! My favorite Peruvian restaurant in the Bay area! The only reason I did not give them all the stars is because I think they could change the ambiance a little bit. I love the homey feel but it could use a little sproosing up! Quality of the food is all stars though!!!
author: Paola N.

description: This a great place to have great Peruvian food.  Try lomo a lo pobre or lomo saltado with a cuzqueňa.
author: Julio U.

description: We went to eat with some friends and we had a blast!  Good food, good service.  It was hot while dining, but they did turn the fans on. We will most likely be going back.
author: Anauski Q.

description:
Haven't came back since a few years ago. Since then they had remodeled and reduced their meals but increased prices. A time before Yelp.

Anyways this was one of the places I went for lunch and still walked out hungry after eating everything. The portions are small and filled with a lot of filler. Filler that fills the plate, not the stomach.
author: M C.

description: I've been coming to Mi lindo Peru my whole life so right off the bat I should probably declare bias because this spot certainly holds a dear place in my heart. My father was personally acquainted with the owner, Carlitos, and he's watched me grow up. Coming from a Peruvian family to whom authentic and indigenous fare is a very important part of our epicurean experience, I'd definitely consider myself someone who recognizes, enjoys, and seeks out the best Peruvian food out there, and Mi lindo has always been my favorite. All of my tias (aunts on my dad's side) also give preferential treatment to the quality dishes offered in this establishment, which is saying a lot since they were all born and raised in and around Lambayeque and Chiclayo, Peru. My family has always dined there and will continue to do so because the service, quality, and presentation remain top notch. I would recommend anyone to go there anytime, ESPECIALLY if it is your first experience with comida peruano. Come to Mi lindo Peru and get a taste of authenticity and integrity.
author: Lucio V.

description: I went to this restaurant and I would have to recommend it to anyone. I generally am not a fan of hispanic food, peruvian, mexican, etc, but this place felt like an exception. It was incredibly tasty, I got something simple -- steak with rice. They managed to make that so incredibly good, I was blown away. They had this great steak sauce that I still think about it. It was 18 dollars, which is on the pricey side, but if you're willing to shell out a little more cash, it is definitely worth it for this place. The menu was incredibly diverse and there was a great big variety of meals to choose from. They had this delicious and unique drink that was called, "Chicha Morada" or sweet purple corn juice. While it might sound somewhat unappealing by the name, do not let that deceive you, it was amazing and paired quite nicely with the meal and general theme of the place. Like even with steak and rice, the flavors mixed, unlike a traditional american soft drink, which cannot really blend well with meals.  The one issue I had was with the wait and the pricey menu, I had to wait a little while to get a seat because it was packed, but that simply means this place is just that good and the whole menu I felt the prices could have been lowered, but there were reasonable. All in all, I would go to this place again and plan on it soon!
author: Logan G.

description: This is probably my honey and I favorite place to eat! The food is ALWAYS consistent and the service is FANTASTIC!! I love how welcoming the waiter is and never hovers but always makes sure we are doing good.if I could give them 10 stars I would lol
author: Noemi D.

description:
This place is AMAZING! I take everyone I know here. Sangria, Apps, Seafood, Chicken, its all amazingly delicious. Its homey vibe makes is comfortable for all and perfect for dates, friends, family, or even take out. 

THIS PLACE IS A MUST TRY!!!

The only thing, they close pretty early, so get there before 8:15 to get fed.
author: Nick F.

description:
Came here recently with a friend around 7pm and was able to find street parking near the restaurant. Our waiter was very polite and patient with us while we browsed the menu while casually sipping on a liter of sangria, LOL. Which by the way, is probably the best sangria I've ever had. A liter is totally OK for two people to share if you're wondering. We ordered ceviche de mariscos, lomo saltado, and gambas al ajo. All of our dishes were rather tasty but did have some things to nitpick about. 
First off, they served us bread with butter and salsa. We were expecting tortilla chips and it totally did not happen. But we love carbs so we ate the bread anyways haha. 

Ceviche de Mariscos- Very generous portions of red snapper, squid, shrimp, red onion, and mussels. The only thing we did not enjoy was the mussels. I don't think the lemon/lime meshes well with cooking the mussel, it was very rough and not very appetizing. 

Lomo Saltado- Just delicious. The sliced beef, onions, peppers, and french fries paired well together. The flavor of the meat was on point. Just wish they didn't cook the meat for so long, as it was rather tough.

Gambas al ajo- Anytime you put excessive amounts of garlic on anything, it is bound to be delicious. Lots of garlic on shrimp?! exxtra delicious! Shrimp was not overcooked at all and they give you a generous amount of shrimp too, which is always a plus. 

Will most definitely be back sometime in the near future to try more foodz and drink more liters of Sangria!
author: Christine G.

description: Such a good family looking spot!! Food was amazing! Had the Saltado De Pollo, everything had so much flavor and the salsa tasted great with everything! Service was fast and efficient. Definitely my new favorite Peruvian spot!
author: Adriana B.

description:
This place was recommended by my neighbor- he claimed that this is his favorite Peruvian restaurant so ofcourse I had to try it. 

I came here with my very picky sister and partner who is a bit of a food snob. 

Pros- clean, fast and friendly service, and pretty decent price. 

I liked my food. 
Sister barely ate hers.
Boyfriend claimed that he's had better paella. 
But we all liked their deep fried potato balls. 

Cons- I thought that the portions were a little small but that could just be the fat, glutenous side of me talking. The price for dinner is a bit pricey in my opinion- I'd definitely stick to lunch if I were to go here and I'm on a budget.
author: Arianne D.

description:
Great Peruvian restaurant!

Service was great.

The food was awesome!

Causa de Pollo for an appetizer is a must try. 

I ordered the Tallarin Saltado de Pollo with green salsa.. Tasted delicious.
author: Gerardo M.

description:
I can't believe I didn't find out about this place sooner. Some of the best chica I've ever had is here (I like that it's not too sweet), and their lomo and lo pobre is ON POINT. All of their meat options are super savory, really. The restaurant itself is small but there's a good amount of tables. It's great for a date or for a larger group. They don't take reservations so plan accordingly! The waiters are attentive and really nice. 

Remember, it's peruvian so come hungry or be prepared to take food home with you!
author: Alberto P.

description:
WORST service ever!! The place isn't busy and the wait staff hang out behind the cash register and basically ignore the customers.  Anytime you need something, you have to get up and find a server and ask for it.  
I couldn't believe when I found out the server was also the owner.  His name is Carlos and you can just tell he hates working there.  I don't think he knows how to smile.  He shouldn't be so cheap and hire someone friendly to wait on customers.  
This is not the only Peruvian restaurant in the city.  We will not be coming back here.  
AVOID THIS PLACE! 

CARLOS, take a class in customer service/hospitality.  You obviously don't know how to properly give customer service.
author: Denise C.

description: Great place.  I was craving Peruvian food, specifically Aji de Gallina, my favorite Peruvian dish.  I always search for Peruvian food when I am out of town.  I found several places around my hotel, however they did not offer Aji de Gallina.  Foiled.  I decided to give this place a try, since they close between lunch and dinner, I decided to have breakfast and an early dinner that day, so I ordered and Uber and headed to the restaurant.  The 4.3 miles drive took 35 minutes at 4:40p.m.  Once I got there, I was the first patron, so I spoke with the person who was there.  We spoke in Spanish since I'm fluent.  I told her I knew what I wanted, I ordered immediately.  The food came out fairly fast.  I added a side of fried sweet plantains and a side salad, besides my Aji de Gallina.  Also to drink I got a Pisco Sour and a typical Peruvian soda, Inca Cola. The portions are big.  My meal was delicious buy I was not able to finish the whole meal.  My cravings have been satisfied for now.
author: Marisa S.

description: Wow, I love this place! Not only the best Peruvian food in the Bay Area, but truly exceptional service. With many choices for Peruvian (La Mar, Limon and Fresca to name a few) here in San Francisco, head down to The Mission district for authentic Peruvian flavors that will have your tastebuds happily engaged.
author: Rich S.

description: Love the flavorful food!! The chicha Morada is BOMB!!! The service is good and you get your order pretty fast. Love to bring family and friends there for a first impression really knocks there socks off!!
author: Greg N.

description: Has the Best Lomo Saltado and amazing customer service! The rice has whole corn mixed in and the dish is always filled with flavor with a good amount of food for your buck! I've gone to Limoń and though their Lomo Saltado is good with crispy fries in the dish, the portions are much smaller a bit more pricy.
author: Semhar G.

description: Had dinner here, great service, highly recommend their ceviche de pezacado and their famous dish lomo saltado. Will come back again :) gracias !
author: Vanessa L.

description: We drive from Oakland for this food.  The pescado frito, salad, bread and noodles are outstanding!  The portions are so generous we split dishes.  Everything is so fresh and well prepared.  We could eat a loaf of their bread.  We have some dietary preferences and they are always very nice and accurate with how they prepare our dishes.  We have been here many many times and the food is consistently excellent.  My only complaint is that they do not have a restaurant in Oakland!
author: Larry R.

description:
To be quite honest we originally came here because my daughter was in the mood for empanadas and I saw on their Yelp page that they served them. Now upon further inspection I see they do not have them anymore per the waiter and to be fair the pics were over eight year old. 
 Upon learning that we decided to give it a try anyway. I am soooo glad we did. They served us sliced bread with butter and a sort of sauce dip  that was super yummy. You place it on the bread and it's such a different experience I loved it. We ordered the chicharron chicken and man was it crispy delicious. It came with a lemon juice dip and a red wine vinegar slaw with onions. 
I ordered the paella marinera. The color was a beautiful bright orange from the saffron rice. It was light and fluffy. They shrimp were great and soft and so were the oysters. I enjoyed every seafood bite 
My daughter ordered the arroz con pollo with cilantro rice. If you love cilantro you will love this rice dish. The rice was light and delicious and tasty just like cilantro. The chicken pieces  were moist as well. 
My husband ordered the steak with potatoes and white rice. The steak was a bit bland so he took the sauce they give you for the bread and poured it over his rice and he loved it more.
If you get a soft drink they do give you can with no refills.
The staff was super friendly and the service was excellent. I can't wait to take someone special with me back so I can enjoy the great flavors avian !
author: Ana F.

description: OMG! The food here is so delicious. We were four people and each of us got a plate to share so we could try more stuff. We got spicy shrimp, ceviche, two meat plates that came with yummy rice, fried plantains and potatoes. We had lucuma ice cream (!!!) for dessert and a tasty flan too. Everything was soooo goood! Highly highly recommend it!
author: Marina T.

description:
Ok I admit I really wanted to like this place more. Who doesn't like supporting the local neighborhoody mom and pop type restaurant? The servers greet you immediately with a sweet smile, they're very responsive, and the food comes out ridiculously fast - it really shows when people understand the service industry. 

The reason why this isn't a higher star review was that the food just didn't quite get there. I will say that the fried plantains were excellent and the ceviche was good. The pisco sours were unfortunately watered down and the grilled rib-eye steak & prawns were immensely overcooked. 

pro tip: the salsa here is spicy!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Excellent Peruvian food !  We came in for lunch, there was only one other table seated which always makes me nervous but I was depending that all these great reviews on Yelp would hold true - and they did!

We started out with bread, butter and sauce which was good.  It's always good sign when they serve good bread and butter!  Then we ordered Lomo Saltado which was good, the meat was flavorful and tender serviced with rice which was just average.  My husband ordered the Aji de gallina which was AMAZING!!

The waiter was very friendly and service was great (note there were only two tables filled, so the table to staff ratio was in my favor).  Street parking was surprisingly easy, though expensive as usual.  

Prices here are really reasonable, especially for Peruvian!

You got to try this place!
author: Andrea B.

description: Yes, still amazing and still my favorite Peruvian spot I can find. I accidentally ordered the cilantro rice with chicken the last time I went and that was the best mistake ever. Absolutely amazing! The service is always great and the restaurant has lots of space to accommodate small and large parties. Go!
author: Daisy D.

description:
There are two things that I am totally addicted to, Latin food and Seafood. I am a huge fan of peruvian food and will often go out of my way to get it. Lucky me, that it was suggested that we go to Mi Lindo Peru to celebrate a night out for my friend Mariela. 

We got there early and secured a table. It's harder than you realize, so don't just try and show up at dinner time with your party of six and expect it to be empty. You take your chances and luckily we scored.

We ordered the Sangria, which in itself is dangerous if you are sipping while waiting for friends. Before we knew it, we polished off a carafe and wanted another. http://goo.gl/Rs7cc

I was all about the MARISCOS and we were all set to have a seafood extravaganza dinner. 

I couldn't get seafood off my mind, so we ordered the Ceviche de Mariscos to start. http://goo.gl/BSahk It was a great portion for two and really flavorful. 

Next up, I ordered the Picante de Mariscos, because if there is anything I love more with my latin seafood dishes - it's spicy food. http://goo.gl/oobdZ Mariela ordered the Parihuela, a seafood soup in a rich flavored base. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. http://goo.gl/FxL7B We both shared the dishes so we could try everything. 

Everything was amazing and the service was great. I really enjoyed the seafood dishes and will come back for more, because this place has great flavor.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
ABSOLUTE HEAVEN - MY MOUTH IS SALIVATING!!!
(5 stars and a meteor shower)

**HIDDEN GEM ALERT**

ONE OF THE BEST PERUVIAN RESTAURANTS I've ever had... okay... maybe THE BEST. Great service, better then any fancy Peruvian Restaurants around the city. And the Chef comes out and serves the plates, definitely appreciate that.

- FOOD, amazingly good
- PRICES, affordable 
- SERVICE, impeccable
- AMBIANCE, small mom and pop kind of spot

Peruvian food is one of my favorite kinds of food. I've been to several Peruvian restaurants (upscale places) around the city and even gone to the Peruvian food festival that happens yearly. Surprised with myself that I have not discovered this HIDDEN GEM earlier!!! I've driven by this place a million times and have read reviews on yelp, finally had the chance to eat here. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

BREAD (free) -  bread while you wait for your meal. Good fresh bread with a spread of butter but don't waste your appetite eating all the bread, your meal portions are big.

PERUVIAN CORN (~$2) - If you never seen Peruvian corn, they are huge. Looks like their pulled each kernel off, fried them, and served it as a side. LOVE IT, always refer to these as "Peruvian corn nuts".

CHICHARRON De CALAMARES ($8.95) - Fried squid serves with their house sauce. the sauce is light pink and has that perfect dipping sauce thats not too powerful and not too light. Also on the side is a pinch of vegetables that tasted like ceviche. Thus far the best place I know in the bay area that knows how to serve up Calamari. Damn good calamari.

SALTADO De POLLO ($12.95) - Lean strips of  chicken sauteed with onions, tomato, and french fries also served with a side of their rice. their rice is NOT typical rice it has a really different taste to it. SO GOOD. And the description sound so simple but the flavors are amazing. If you had Lomo Saltado, you know exactly what i mean. This is the first place to have a chicken version of lomo saltado. absolute heaven!!! Well worth your money, get left overs, and the portions of the serving is ALOT.

GAMBAS AL AJO ($15.95) - prawns sauteed in wine, butter, and garlic sauce served with rice. Same kind of rice as their serve with all their other dishes. The sauce on the prawns was droolicious and they give you good amount of prawns. Well worth your money.

LUCUMA ICE CREAM (~$4) - topped the meal with some ice cream. OMG I love lucuma ice cream. Had it several times in the past at other restaurants and will order it again and again. It's orange and you'd think it tastes very fruity but its not like that. It's a subtle creamy light taste. My mouth is salivating.

Will I be back? You don't have to ask me twice!!!!

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in the city... Been going here for years- consistent cooking, you never get a plate that tasted better the last time.  Order the Lomo Saltado it's got to be one of their most popular dishes... and you can't go wrong :) Although everything that I've had there is delicious. 

Come hungry-their plates are big! And relax... the owner and staff make you feel at home... I would give them a 6th star if there was an option. 

THANKS MI LINDO FOR THE AWESOME FOOD
author: Corey G.

description: Told my Mom of this place but arrived at 2:40pm and was turned away. I guess time of operations are as is no EXCEPTIONS.  Ohh well
author: Elias S.

description: Started with Chicharron De Calamares, which was a tad salty but dipping sauce was good.  Our table had lomo saltado and gambas al ajo which was very tasty.  But pescado frito was very fishy tasting and did not seem too fresh. Won't order this next time.  Friendly and efficient service.
author: Sashimi W.

description: Mi Lindo Peru! Is the spot! Lomo saltado on point! Service or take out is always reliable. I recommend getting the anticuchos (beef heart) for appetizers! Love the bread on the table, who doesn't love bread with butter at a restaurant. Stop by with the family, a date, or a group of people. Make sure to order a pisco sour.
author: J M.

description:
I had dinner with a friend who had been here before and really enjoyed the food. So, of course I jumped at the chance to come here and try Peruvian food for the first time.

We came around 6:30pm and it wasn't packed so we were seated right away. Our waiter brought us the menus and asked us what we wanted to drink. We both said water. After a couple of minutes, I decided on the pollo saltado and my friend ordered the lomo saltado. Our waiter then brought us bread and hot sauce.

Our food came out fairly quickly and I was thrilled that the portions were big. The chicken was really flavorful and tasted good with the hot sauce too. The fries and rice were good and not overcooked. My friend liked her lomo saltado as well. 

All in all, I was very pleased with the food. Our service was also good. Our waiter was nice and was on top of filling our water glasses without being asked and also didn't forget when we needed more hot sauce. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Fallon P.

description:
My favorite Peruvian restaurant in the city to go to. Restaurant is a little small but has nice decor inside that makes it very comfortable to sit and have lunch/dinner. Definitely a wonderful restaurant that highlights what peruvian food is. Good to go with a group and a great restaurant to take someone who wants to try Pervuian food for the first time! :)

Must haves:
- Lomo saltado: the beef is cooked to perfection with on point seasoning and sauce over fries that are not soggy. One of my favorite dishes to order whenever I go there. Portion is also very large and filling! 
- Lemon garlic chicken: To die for!! The chicken pieces are fried with minced garlic and is served with a lemon sauce that is sooooo good! A great appetizer to get and share with others. A must order!

Quick tip: better to go for lunch if you want to spend a little less. Dinner time has similar dishes as lunch but prices are higher so it is probably more worth it to go for lunch.

Parking can be hard as it is in the mission but there are smaller streets to the right and up the hill that may have spots. These are not metered and normally are 2 hour parking limit spots. I usually do not pay for metered spots as they are pretty expensive in the city and I like to enjoy my meals and not have to rush.
author: Wendy Z.

description: I've been taking friends here for years - it's one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I always get the arroz con pollo with Cristal Peruvian beer.  You can get the pollo (chicken) either fried or grilled. Although I've been ordering the same dish all the time, the chicken has been consistently tender and the rice is infused with abundant cilantro and I'm never disappointed with their service.  Mi Lindo Peru is an unpretentious restaurant catering to locals and families and provides earnestly prepared ethnic Peruvian food at reasonable prices.  Restaurants in SF are always closing due to increasing costs of doing business in the city and changing customer tastes. In light of this, I fervently hope Mi Lindo Peru remains in business for years to come.
author: Yoshi O.

description:
I'm afraid I just don't see what the fuss is about.

They had several tasty items but overall the food missed the expectations set by the price.  Plus it was empty at dinner time on a weekday?
author: joe b.

description:
This place is delicious! So much flavor, something different for foodies and curious diners.

I have been wanting to go here for two years and finally stopped by with a friend. We ordered everything we wanted on the menu and still our bill was remarkably low.

I love the atmosphere and feel of the restaurant. Small, dark, intimate and somewhat divey, much like you'd expect with restaurants on the mission. The place fills up quickly and there isn't much room to wait by the door, but luckily there are a few cute bars around if you have to wait for your table.

Attentive and friendly staff- I will be back very soon!
author: Nika C.

description: They have the most flavorful lomo saltado I've ever had! I would take Mi Lindo Peru lomo saltado over Limons any day! They give somewhat larger portions then Limon and I usually get it with half rice half salad. The dish is about 15-16 from what I remember, but seeing that I always have to pack a ToGo box, it's basically lunch for two days. I can't really speak on the other dishes that they have as this is my go to item and it never disappoints me!
author: Semhar G.

description:
Came here for the first time yesterday and was slightly let down because of the lack of seasoning in my aji de gallina. After some salt and pepper, the dish tasted great! Unfortunately I cannot say it is the best aji de gallina I've ever had- but definitely still yummy. Fluffy bread and tasty butter is given to you while you wait for your meal. The restaurant is fairly small so definitely call ahead to see if you can get a spot! For some reason there are not too many peruvian sit down options here in SF compared to Chicago... So when I found out about this place I definitely knew I had to try it! The papa rellena is wonderful and crispy! Also, their chicha morada is very delicious and I recommend to go ahead and order the 1 L jug when you sit down!

Overall, a great experience. Very reasonable prices. Next time, I'll definitely try something else on their menu... Hopefully it will be properly seasoned!!
author: Anna G.

description:
Every now and then I'm in the area for a meeting. I love this place. The staff are terrific and the meals come out fast. I have only tried the seafood dishes because the rice or sides are so filling, I'm always afraid I might over do it. 

The salsa does have a huge kick, so if can't man up, don't eat it.
author: Evelyn K.

description:
5 STARS! A friend of mine and his lady friend decided to take me here and I was not disappointed.

Atmosphere is very relaxing; dim lights and good tunes. The service is super attentive and friendly.

The waiter could insult me and I'd stay for the plate.. THAT'S how good the food is. I had the Lomo Saltado, as suggested by a previous yelper. It was perfectly seasoned and portioned. The food just kind of chewed itself and went down my tract on its own.

Wanted to grab dessert but I wasn't feeling lucky. Overall excellent experience and good spot to take a date. Again, 5 STARS!
author: Clouob P.

description:
This restaurant is easy to miss because it doesn't have a sign that sticks out over the sidewalk. But find it, and go! It's so good.

I loved the Pescado Sudado. It included a fillet of snapper topped with a tomato sauce including onions and veggies. It was so hearty and savory, but light and not too indulgent! 

I also tried my husband's Pisco Sour. It was so delicious! Not too sweet or too sour, and HIGH in alcohol content ;)

I can't wait to go again!
author: Christina W.

description:
Mi Lindo Peru has been at it's location forever and I hope it never closes! Ok maybe only 20 years and the big change that has happened is the prices which are much higher than they used to be but still it's a great place to come with friends and share some delicious food. 

Yes they use different fish for the ceviche than is traditionally used, yes the prices have increase, yes the service is very family style as is the decor but it's still delicious food. The ceviches are family size as are many of the dishes. 

The decor hasn't changed in years.  The sangria packs a punch and is well priced. 

The space is accessible.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
I'm a regular here!
It goes like this.. a peruvian beer, mixed salad(great for 2), fried yuca/mussels to start then the lomo saltado!! Delicious, simple and affordable! boom!
author: Carol F.

description:
After discovering my husband's home country of Italy has a good sized Peruvian community with delicious, affordable Peruvian food geared towards said community, I've complained to anyone who'd listen that San Francisco has a tendency to take all that is delicious from other countries, dress it up as something trendy, and overcharge accordingly while not keeping true to authenticity. 

As a result I gave up on the idea of finding a low key, affordable, and delicious Peruvian restaurant, until Mi Lindo Peru!  Love the cebiche here.  It's fresh and portions are good for the price.  The lomo saltado is always a crowd pleaser, but the papas huancaina can be a little bland, no big deal, more room for more cebiche!   

No pisco sours here, but they have a decent sangria.
author: T V.

description:
I have been visiting this restaurant for at least 20 years and it's still as marvelous as the first day I decided to try it. It's a neighborhood gem, that is for sure. I used to live in the neighborhood, so don't get out this way all that often nowadays.

Yesterday was an exception - we were out having drinks and decided to get some hearty Peruvian food before we took off for home. Two of us had arroz con pollo and our friend had a steak dish. The food was fresh and plentiful. The house salsa was complex and picante. 

We had the plantains for appetizer which was served with a delectable cream. I can't remember having arroz con pollo that was as flavorful as we had yesterday. We were all very happy with our food and the service was great. 

I hope I can get back there again before too long!
author: Lisa F.

description: Clean and great service.  This restaurant is located right on Mission street in the heart of the Mission. I love Peruvian food!  It's so tasty!  My fave here is the Lomo Saltado!  Great portion size!  The offer free bread and butter too with their home made salsa.  The salsa is a bit spicy but that's how I like it.  I will def be back!
author: Rissa K.

description: I had a great first time here!! I tried various dishes and they were superb! Salsa is a bit spicy but it's so good. It was different,  bread so soft. The music in the Resturant gives it a great Peruvian feel. If your a seafood lover this is the spot! My friends all had seafood dishes with lil creepy looking sea creatures but...... It was amazing.
author: Ermila W.

description:
Delicious Peruvian restaurant in Mission:)
I wanna go back here for the Gambas All Ajillo (Garlic Shrimp) and Paella De Verderas (Vegetable Paella). Many many appetizers to choose from:)
author: Maitai N.

description: The service was great but the food wasn't. I ordered the bistec a lo Pobre and it was okay but the steak was hard and the jalea was also okay but definitely not the best.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
We ordered the papa a la huancaina, arroz con pollo and aji de gallina.

The arroz con pollo was really good. They give you this 'curtido' which makes the plate really really good. Highly recommend this plate/place.

The papa a la huancaina was good. 

The aji de gallina was good too.

The portions are really big and the service is friendly.
author: H C.

description:
I know nothing about Peruvian food so you can imagine my confusion upon eating here for my first time. Stir fry with French fries? Really? What kind of magic is this?

Very casual ambiance, service and food. Feels like I am visiting someone's house and the food feels like a family has made these special for me. No pretenses or flash, just damn good food.
author: Ge O.

description: Such great food at reasonable prices. Favorites: Lomo Al Pobre, Ceviche, Anticuchos, with a nice Cusqueña beer!
author: Manny H.

description:
This place was aiiight. I was expecting the Chicharron Al Ajo (chicken smothered in garlic) to be bite worthy but there was no bite to the garlic. I wanted to be punched by all the flavor of the spices and garlic but all I got was a semi dry chicken wings with weak garlic over it. 

As for my main dish I had the Bisteck steak dish. Again it looked like the flavor of the steak was going to attack my taste buds but it fell short and flat. My taste buds were disappointed. :(

As for the service of this place. I'll give it an "A". The servers were fast to seat us even though it was packed at the time we arrived. 

Overall- if you're looking for a place to eat in the mission and is tired of eating burritos and tacos. I'd recommend this place.
author: Lakeen W.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE!  AVOID THIS PLACE! AVOID THIS PLACE!

Besides the lack of flavor  in their food, Service is fairly good! Their server was prompt and helpful!

 Apparently two things might of happen! They were hungry for more tips  and they decided to tras my receipt and singed for me and added themselves a 20 dollar tip! 

Or  they brought the receipt to some one else. I don't know the point here is that I was over charged and the manager of the restaurant has the never to tell me that she has me on camera signing for the paper. Of course I signed the paper because I was paying for my meal but  the signature they sent me  is not my signature neither my hand writing. 


If I was you I will avoid this place.  Seriously is not worth it. They stole my money.
author: Jorge O.

description:
I first tried this restaurant some time ago on a UYE.  Living nearby, it was perfect.  That night we tried just about everything.

Since then, I've been back several times and tried a few more dishes.  The one thing I can eat all day is the bread, butter and salsa they serve on every table.  Spread some butter on the bread, maybe the fat in the butter acts like a shield for the salsa.  Spoon on the spicy salsa, with plenty of onion, and I'm happy.

I've had several dishes here, from Pescado al Ajo, Lomo Saltado, Chicharron al Ajo, Garlic Soup, ... you seeing a theme?  Garlic!  I've had another steak dish, but can't recall the name, but it was almost like the Saltado, but without the fries.  I am always happy with the Lomo Saltado, with strips of steak, fries, onions and tomato.  Served with rice, it is carb overload, but it's worth it.  People say this is where Peruvians eat.

Service is friendly, and they are always willing to make a suggestion for those not sure what they want.  Parking may be hard, but Bank of America has a lot available after banking hours, and you can always circle Mission Street.
author: Michael M.

description:
Pros:
-Que me hablaran en español porque miro Peruano (chifa). My ethnic identity has been questioned a few times while dining here, and Spanish has been spoken to me more times than I feel comfortable to try to respond with my Spanglish. But even though after a few seconds later they realize I am only Asian-American, and not Latino the tone and service is still generally positive and friendly.

1. all the house-made sauces are delicious, I particularly enjoy the habanera spread for the bread.. it offers just the right amount of spice for all the cooling seafood dishes I crave so much while dining here.
2. fresh paella marinea, simmered with rice in a saffron sauce with sherry wine is nice and comforting.
3. ceviche de mariscos: red snapper, calimari, mussel, and prawns in fresh lime juice, soft yam, with kernels for a crunch.

Cons:
Sometimes this place feels a bit slow when it is really busy and packed, I can't fathom why there are couples taking up 4 seats all throughout the restaurant sometimes, when the tables could easily be pulled apart to accommodate everyone else waiting out the door. It can get unbearably loud sometimes, because the room reverberates noise in all directions. And the silverware looks thrifted and wouldn't hurt to get a fresh polish.
author: Ty T.

description:
We had a high expectation on the food, but the flavor and the presentation were really lacking unfortunately.  

I'm puzzled why so many people love this place. They do give you a generous portion, but that's about it.   The food quality is not at the same level as Fresca, Limon or La Mar, not close.

The service was really good.
author: Danielle W.

description:
I wasn't so sure about this place, I've heard mixed reviews from the foodies around me, but I still wanted to give it a try. 

Upon walking in I noticed the place was a lot smaller then I had expected, but it was busy, even at nearly 9:15pm on a weekday. We waited about 10 minutes for a table, wasn't too bad.

The decor is great, fresh, vibrant but dim lighting, which I prefer. The chairs were comfortable and I didn't mind the layout of the tables, lots of room for moving and walking.

Friendly staff, polite, kind, attentive. 

The ceviche was pretty darn good, the fish held the most flavor, I don't feel like it was freshly made to order, but it was still very yummy, the fresh mussels were a nice touch.

We had another dish, but the name escapes me (photo included), it was also very yummy the fish and calamari were tender, even after being cooked. Perfecto.

Worcestershire Shrimp, what an interesting concept. The prawns were huge and left in there shell, the dish was served on a shallow bowl with the prawns on a bed of sauce and potato. After spending a little time pealing the darn shrimp (without projecting it at my dining companion) I was able to take a bite of this seriously flavourful dish. The effort was worth it, the sweet and salty flavour was HEAVENLY. I would totally order this dish again.

Sangria was wonderful, much less tuttie-frutie and more wine flavour which is how I prefer my Sangria. 

Minus one star for the short hours on the weekends.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Mi Lindo Peru is a cute restaruant in Bernal Heights, and the mom and pop version of the flashier Limon. We came on a Saturday night around 8pm without reservations, and had to wait 10-15 minutes for a party of 5. The service here is friendly, but not super polished. Since Peruvian cuisine is best eaten family style, we ordered a bunch of dishes to try:

-Pisco Sour (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A): Good, but no different from other good pisco sours I've had.
-Anticuhos/Beef Heart (Peruvian Shish-Kabab Served w/Grilled Potatoes, $6.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#hX5Jpx9mRKd_Si7oLxsVTw): Okay. I didn't love the glaze or the springiness of the beef heart. Skip.
-Empanada (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#ldQ60W6RAHkf4fR5uMKbBQ): The flaky crust of the empanada was really good, but the filling was just ok. I liked the pickled vegetables it was served with more than the empanada itself.
-Yucca Frita (Fried Yucca Served w/White Cheese & Yellow Chile, $5.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#PfsZSECtqRuMEqrONM0sCw): Yum! The yucca was perfectly fried and the batter wasn't too thick. However, the white cheese sauce was amazing and really made this dish. A must order!
-Ceviche De Pescado (White Fish Marinated in Fresh Lime Juice, $13.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#UrZVcG614pYOjYsAPMJ1gw): Pretty good! I liked the white fish they used in the ceviche, and it wasn't overly tangy.
-Bisteck a Lo Pobre (Top-Sirloin Steak Sauteed w/Onions & Tomatoes, Topped w/Fried Plantain & Egg, $14.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#A2JPibLHH4qSVuW0nccV6A): Pretty good, but a little salty and the beef was overcooked. However, the flavors were good and I still ate a good amount. This dish is a great value since it's a huge portion.
-Pescado Al Ajo (Fried Red Snapper Topped w/Butter Garlic Sauce & a Touch of White Wine, $13.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi-lindo-per%C3%BA-san-francisco-2?select=3vElPQHYPtUbV-Kq6bDq2A#E3UTp6UL6q5Y70TEDN9naw): Yum! I really liked the batter they used for the snapper, and this is a dish I haven't had before. Recommended!

Overall, I enjoyed my Peruvian dinner at Mi Lindo Peru. The food was really good, but nothing so amazing that I'm planning my next meal here. The service was attentive since the dinner rush was over and they were able to spend more time with our table. The food came out at a good pace, which was appreciated. Parking in this area can be tricky, but street parking is available.
author: Amy D.

description: I have to say that this is the best Peruvian restaurant hands down.  The food is exquisite, the service superb and the atmosphere comforting.  Carlos, the owner/waiter is friendly, polite and attentive. I've been going there for years and always come back.  I highly recommend the Lomo Saltado, Bistec a la pobre and the Chicaron al ajo. Mouth Watering menu.  Bravo! A+ restaurant.
author: Roger O.

description: Really solid homestyle food - like I was going to my hypothetical Peruvian friend's parents' home for dinner. The table was a little sticky. Server was very warm though. Food was flavorful, if not a bit greasy. I didn't find the prices to be that low, other than the sides, which were a great value.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Bland-o-rama. Really nice service but the food?  Eh. 
I don't understand my fellow yelpers. This place is so mediocre. And especially for the price! We basically ate all starch and some protein. No fresh veggies in the mix at all. We got 4 dishes: yucca fries, ceviche, pollo saffron arroz, and seafood paella.  Every dish was only seafood and starch. The ceviche was good but was only cubed fish and lime juice... And no chips for a vehicle. The sangria was tasty but too sweet. All in all, sweet service but not my kind of a meal especially for $100. What?!?  I gave it 2 stars cause at least I left feeling full and with leftovers. Who can eat a basket of bread, a bowl of potatoes and a huge plate of rice with chicken?
author: Sara P.

description:
The only other Peruvian restaurant I've dined in was Fresca. But I consider Fresca to be more Californian than Peruvian, so technically Mi Lindo Peru was my first Peruvian experience.

On a random Tuesday night, a bunch of us decided to invade this small but vibrant restaurant. From the moment I set foot in this place, I knew it was going to be a good night. 30 minutes before our reservation, our table was already set to go. 

Thank goodness we selected our dishes ahead of time. The menu was quite overwhelming given the number of choices. Each dish contained many ingredients so it was difficult to imagine the taste. But just know that you cannot go wrong with any dishes! The ingredients may seem simple, but every dish had such extraordinary flavors!

Ceviche Mixto (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1DDbE3XJF6lFL_KpU6Pmww?select=k5tM7gWUOcTEywcOD6xzpg): If you love ceviche, then this one is a winner. Huge recognizable pieces of seafood soaked in a bath of fresh lime juice. The first bite definitely made me puckered, but oh so addicting!

Chicharron de Pollo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1DDbE3XJF6lFL_KpU6Pmww?select=mkPnVGGbcIRUy1M7--rTtQ): Breaded chicken served with lemon juice. The chicken was so crunchy and juicy by itself. Then with the lemon juice mixture, wow what a kick!

Pescado Sudado (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1DDbE3XJF6lFL_KpU6Pmww?select=uUxLRSL6Ox3oM3z5P05pew): Steamed snapper fillet. Unfortunately I only saw this dish in passing, and didn't get to try it. But judging by how fast the snapper disappeared, I would say this was another successful dish!

Pescado Al Ajo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1DDbE3XJF6lFL_KpU6Pmww?select=V861Q92lwDwnC551aURxmQ): Fried butter and garlic snapper. This was the favorite of the night. And I believe it was because the flavorful thick crunchy crust was holding the most steamy and moist snapper inside. Oh la la!

The Saltado de Pollo (chicken strips) and Lomo Saltado (beef strips) were so good! Both sautéed with onions, tomatoes and french fries. Very hearty. Weird to have sautéed fries? Think of them as fried potatoes!

Arroz Con Pollo is a rice dish sautéed in cilantro sauces. Although the dish was green in color, it was not dominated by cilantro flavor. The sauce made the rice very fluffy! Yum!

Service was impeccable. I don't think the restaurant was used to handling a party of our size. But throughout the whole night, Carlos (owner manager) did not miss a step. We asked, he gave. We didn't ask, he still gave!

Cheers to a wonderful night of great food, great service and of course great company! =D
author: Marti L.

description: My friend and I came here for a quick dinner on a Sunday night, and upon arriving we were seated immediately. There wasn't many people in this restaurant, perhaps because many residents take out or are exploring the many other options nearby. The waiter was very nice and charming, and was great with the water refills. I ordered the saltado de pollo, which is basically french fries, chicken, onions, and some magic sprinkled on top. For you SoCal people -- it is akin to a California Burrito (bowl) but less greasy and cheesy. I love California Burritos, so this was pretty exciting for me. Large portions that I could not finish, but nice to take home for an equally (albeit more soggy) lunch the next day. Would come back just for the saltado de pollo!
author: Hurnan V.

description:
A bit overpriced for food that is not 5 star material, it's a joke right? A group of us came to dine and naturally wanted to sit together, the staff refused to accommodate us and informed us we had to sit separately because the long table would get in the way of walking. I was confused because it wasn't going to block anything, they were being dramatic.

They were out of empanadas that day.

We ordered an array of dishes, but everything was mediocre. I've had better Peruvian food, this place is misleading.
author: Briget P.

description:
From now on this place should be called Nuestro Muy Lindo Peru. Standing from the outside looking in, this small cozy restaurant embodies the spirit of "fiesta familiar" via its red and mango colored coordination from the inside out to which projects a vibrant atmosphere suitable for both intimate and festive occasions. This place has been sitting on my radar for the past year after having the privilege of dining at other great restaurants in the area. Finally I had the chance to co-sponsor a private UYE with prolific Yelper Marti L. that brought 30 Yelpers to break bread here, including a much appreciated appearance by Yelp co-founder, Russ S. and good friend and East Bay CM Ligaya T. 

I had the pleasure to reconnect with many Yelpers and met several Bay Area notables for the first time. This included Darryl P, Danny L, David B, Simone W, Jason G, Jonathan W, Karen Y, Michael M, Phillip W, Peter L, Hannah C, May C, Dorothy C and husband Peter, Rinky N and husband Mike, Stephanie J and her guest Linh, Tom R, Manabu M, Tammy C, Earl G and wife Joyce, Hen A, Marti L and boyfriend Sam, Russ S and Ligaya T.

We ordered a total of 22 dishes for a family style feast and had a lot of fun passing them around. To mention a few, we shared:

***Appetizers:
Chicharron De Pollo - breaded piecesof chicken with lemon juice
Ceviche Mixto - assorted seafood in fresh lime juice

***Main Entrees:
Saltado De Pollo - lean strips of chicken sauteed w / onions, tomatoes & french fries
Lomo Saltado - lean strips of beef sauteed w/ onions, tomatoes & french fries
Paella Marinera - saffron flavored spanish rice with seafood
Pescado Sudado - steamed snapper fillet topped w/ onions, tomatoes and potatoes
Arroz Con Pollo- chicken cooked with rice and green peas in cilantro sauce
Tamal De Pollo- steamed corn dough stuffed with chicken
Pescado Al Ajo- fried fillet topped with a butter-garlic sauce and a touch of white wine served with seasoned rice and sliced potato
Plantains- fried bananas

***Vegan Dishes (Special request):
Ensalada Mixta--mixed greens with avocado, potatoes & tomatoes with a vinaigrette dressing
Saltado De Vegetables - sauteed onions, celery, carrots, mushrooms, tomatoes & french fries served w/ seasoned rice
Paella De Verduras - saffron flavored spanish rice with vegetables 

Throughout the dinner people were talking about how much they enjoyed the ceviche, pescado al ajo, and paella. Playing host, I didn't get to try all the dishes but thought the Arroz Con Pollo, Saltado De Pollo, Lomo Saltado, and Pescado Al Ajo were very good. The paella unfortunately didn't have the crispy texture but the flavor was still robust and a major highlight of the evening. The only dish that didn't win people over was chicharron de pollo which people said was dry. I also thought the tamal de pollo was decent. Portions were very generous.

The owner, Carlos, was the most pleasant and easy person to work with. I had the opportunity to work closely with him for a month to plan this event. The U-shaped table arrangement wasn't the easiest for everyone to intermingle, but it also gave us a nice open area for people to eventually get out of their seats and reach out to those they haven't seen in a while. Carlos was our server and was the most attentive, caring, and knowledgeable on which dishes were good for sharing; and was very effective in serving to the needs of our vegan friends. For a group of this size, he gave us the best service I've ever experienced to date. 

My co-sponsor, Marti L, was instrumental in the success of this event and I can't thank her enough for the work she's done. Just to be clear to my readers, the restaurant did not have advanced knowledge that this was a Yelp event so the scores of affiliated reviews were reflective of how the restaurant normally operates.
