description: Tried the steak with onions/banana over rice, it was a little over done but not bad.  My owna had the fried snapper which was delicious.  The sangria is really good.  They had some tasty bread and spicy salsa also.  The appetizers I tried were this creamy potatoe-cheese thing which was pretty good.  The meat filled with raisins and onion patties were yummy.  The decor is light yellow and cute..very inviting and warm atmosphere.  I was pretty satisfied with the peruvian authentic experience and would come again but try some of the other plates.   Panda says paws up to this outer mission joint.
author: Steven L.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants here in the city. I LOVE this place! The only con is parking. It always takes me at least couple of tries around the area, maybe in the 4 block radius, before I find parking. I don't mind going round and round though, because when I crave Mi Lindo Peru, I don't care if I use up all my gas finding parking! With the current gas prices, THAT'S saying something!

This is a little restaurant with a very "feel at home" atmosphere. The service is great, the food is amazing, and the prices are reasonable. You start with complimentary bread and salsa, and we can sit there all night just eating those.  However, my favorite appetizer is the CHORROS A LA CRIOLLE (mussels with lots of onions and cilantro, with a spritz of lime - and i hope i spelled that right), and my boyfriend's fave appetizer is the CHICHARON DE POLLO, which is little fried chickens.  My boyfriend would turn that into a KFC-type Bucket of chicken if he could!  We've also tried the CEVICHE, and that was heavenly! I was speechless after trying that. All you can hear from me was, "mmm... mmm... mmm..." after every bite.  My fave dish is Lomo Saltado (no tomato though, I hate tomato, then I ask if I can have a side of fried egg on it... THE BEST!)  and my boyfriend's fave, Pescado Saltado. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They're all very delicious!  Especially the SANGRIA. I can have liters and liters of that, but I heard that's not good for my health... hehehe *shifty*

And best of all, the owner is cute! I love "C"! He's cute, funny, and he used to personally deliver at our work, even though they didn't have delivery! It's because my coworkers and I used to order from them a lot, and we've had many get togethers at the restaurant. Now THAT'S customer service!
author: L O.

description: A big fan of the ma and pa, i wanted to *LOVE* mi lindo peru.. The halibut ceviche was remarkable, my kudos to that. And service was sweet, very humble yet efficient, made us feel like familia. But other items lacked a spark that would've brought me back-- Sangria was more juice than wine (a faux pas on the girl's nite meet-up spot), other tapas lacked inventive flavor (how can ya mess up shrimp w/ garlic its hard to say, but i wasn't particularly warm so it didn't scream "fresh off the skillet" in any way..) Mayonnaise was on heavy feature (really? Peru? i need to refresh my geography but i've not encountered that before in this cuisine) which limited my "wish list" of menu items (ok, i can't dock them stars for my mayonnaise gag reflex, but i'll mention it in case you are my twin of tongue :) That said, the setting is homey, small enough to feel intimate and it did us well as a spot for collecting "all the latest" while getting our garlic breathe on.. (and when boy came to meet @ the end, i just had him finish the shrimp to shore up the situation..)
author: Rachel S.

description: This place was ok.  I've had better Peruvian food.  I ordered the Lomo Saltado and Pollo Saltado.  There were more fries than meat.  If you guys are ever in the Hollywood area, try Mario's.  That place is awesome!
author: Mm M.

description: Wish I had found this place sooner!  A neighborhood place with large portions at reasonable prices. Doesn't have the swankiness of Limon but the food is just as good without the priceness. The lomo saltado is a must try which comes as chicken or beef with french fries.  The fish dishes are also good.  Try to catch the lunch special on the weekdays which average about $5-$6.00.  Keep in mind that prices go up on the weekends.  Very friendly service and bright decor!  One of my favorite Peruvian places.
author: Eric G.

description: Sangria!! Seems like every table had at least a pitcher or two or three of it.  The positive reviews on yelp tempted me to go try this place. The food although semi-delicious, seemed to be in big quantities which is always good to see. The place was packed with locals which also is always a good sign, and most of them seemed to be regulars. I will for sure return when my craving for a really good sangria returns.
author: Raj K.

description: Good selection of tapas. I had the calamari and the tamale both were good, not the most pretty tamale, but tasted good in the tummy. Also had the yucca, next time i want to try the ceviche, and i will be back, mos def.
author: wayne s.

description: Very yummy! I had the shrimp and fries with the Peruvian fruit juice stuff. I've never had Peruvian food before, and whether or not it's authentic, it's definitely good food. :)
author: K R.

description:
have been going here for 6 years now and love it so.
its a nice, quaint little restaurant, casual atmosphere with great service.
the food is super tasty - i'd recommend the bistec la chorillana (or any steak dish there really)
arroz con pollo
and the sangria!
yum!
author: P L.

description:
I really love this place. My husband and I stumbled upon Mi Lindo Peru on Valentine's day years ago. It turned out to be an amazing meal that we have returned to many times. Because we love our favorite dishes so much, we rarely stray from our staple dishes which include:

Garlic Soup (oh sooooo yummy)
Champignons (mushrooms simmered in a spectacular sauce of butter and garlic)
One order of Loma Saltado (it's so big, it fills both of our tummies)
& dessert

We love the unpretentious atmosphere, full of people speaking Spanish and enjoying what feels like a family business. The service is warm and gracious and we always feel at home. I'd pick this over Limon anyday.
author: Celeste M.

description: Never had Peruvian food before.  I don't know what dishes are suppose to taste like but all i know is this place is GOOD and CHEAP and have HUGE portions.  The service was super!
author: Kirstie R.

description: I have very fond memories of dining at Mi Lindo Peru during my junior yr @ Cal. When I returned a few weeks ago wanting to re-live my Peru adventure, it was with those mouthwatering memories in mind. Sadly, much has changed about Mi Lindo Peru during my hiatus from the eatery. First things first, it seems that the restaurant has tried to "upscale-ify" itself. This is reflected not only in the decor, but also in the prices. Second, despite the prices having gone up, the portion size has gone down! Blasphemy! Luckily for me, the lomo saltado (pictured below, right) still tasted as delicious as before... there was just less of it to devour. The ceviche mixto (picture below, left), is very citrus-tangy, and refreshing in small quantities. They actually give you quite a bit of seafood... but my dining partner and I ended up leaving about 1/4 to a 1/3 of of it untouched. We also ordered a steamed snapper... but unfortunately, it was bland, and definitely the worst tasting dish of the night. I would not order it again. I will probably be returning to Mi Lindo Peru when I want to revisit Peru memories... and I'll be ordering the lomo saltado.
author: Susanna W.

description: I had an excellent experience at Mi Lindo Peru.  The food was more home cooking than gourmet cuisine but was very comforting on a rainy night.  The atmosphere was lively and bustling.  It was a great place for a small group and a great price performer.  I would definitely go back.
author: Tara T.

description: We brought out of town guests here this weekend and everyone enjoyed their meals.  The biggest hit was my dining partner's Bistek a la Pobre, which included steak topped with a plantain and egg.  As for me, the pescatarian, the paella mariscos was good too.  I'd go back but it did not rock my world.
author: erin h.

description: Awesome, friendly family run restaurant.  Great for groups or families.  Order the Chupe de Camerones.  You will not reget it!
author: Jumbo J.

description: I stopped by here with no reservation (the place was packed) with a friend of mine on Friday night. We were seated right away and the service was incredible, even though every server seemed to be in the weeds. The Sangria was tasty and the Lomo Saltado (one of my all-time favorite dishes) was to die for. I highly recommend it. My friend and I got out of there for $15 each, even with an appetizer. I liked the family owned and operated feeling and everyone there was very friendly. The music selection was fabu as well. Highly recommended for a casual, inexpensive dinner with friends!
author: Heather M.

description: I LOVE MI LINDO PERU! Split any dish with another person along with an appetizer and you will go home perfectly full...unless you are able to consume HUGE amounts of food in one sitting. Papas la huancaina are my favorite!
author: Emily C.

description: Ahh...this place is good.  Great service, food...the lomo saltado is a consistent and tasty dish.  If you want a no frills, homey atmosphere that serves good food, this is a place to go.  If you want something a little fancier, then Limon is a decent alternative.
author: Ricky P.

description: I've been going here for years.  There peruvian dishes are pretty good...try their anticuchos( beef heart) as an appetizer....a lomo saltado (sauteed beef w/ onions tomatoes, french fries) as a main dish and an alfaore ( a sugar cookie) as dessert.  Mmmm they serve you bread and this delicious red salsa...that has you dippin for more.  If you haven't tasted Peruvian food before this is a good place to start =)
author: Mz. Opinionated Z.

description: mi lindo peru, is currently my favorite peruvian restaurant in northern california.  i've tried many dishes here and have not been disapointed with any ordered.  many of the dishes here come out as individual platters and i do wish it can be ordered family style, but we make do.  the food here is great and i need to return once again for a great meal.
author: Burry B.

description: I really wanted to love this restaurant. There were immediate pluses: easy parking, pleasing decor, friendly staff, kid-friendliness (my daughter was given a cow-face shaped and decorated plate), and tasty looking menu with lots of choices. However, I wasn't blown away with the food. Nothing was bad. Everything tasted good. We shared the carne empanada, tamal de pollo, fried yucca with cheese sauce, plantains, and steak shish kabob. We enjoyed everything, and the sangria was refreshing, but it wasn't great. I left pretty satisfied, but Limon and Cha Cha Cha's were both better.
author: Krista M.

description: Been eating here since Manora's moved out (20 years already?).  My 4 kids used to pick this place when we went out for a birthday treat.   They've also catered countless home & work parties for me.  Carlos & Grace are the best!
author: Jombo J.

description: food is great. place is comforting. neighborhood is ... questionable, but SHRUGS if you want good food, the Mission is where you want to go!
author: TEE R.

description: we had pescado ceviche awesome pescado ceviche with mixed seafood  i had the chicken with green peas and cilantro big plate of food we also had prawns mussels and calamari two drinks this place is tastie and very inexpensive i highly recomend great taste great value enjoy
author: tommy b.

description: I love love love this place! I came here with hubby after a LONG day of evil screaming babies clingy onto my back. I needed good food and good Sangria! Mi Lindo Peru did not disappoint. We ordered the small pitcher of Sangria, but they gave us a large pitcher, whatever, the more the merrier! I had the seafood pasta and hubby had some grilled steak with rice! The portions are huge and the prices are really cheap! The food was so tasty and colorful! After my second glass of Sangria I was feeling mighty happy and turning more red than a white man with a sun burn! When the bill came, they charged us for a small pitcher instead of a large! SCORE! After finishing the last of the Sangria, hubby had to drag my ass up the hill to the car because I was starting to see three hubbies holding me. I don't remember too much of what happen after that. All I know what that I woke up on our bathroom floor with the toilet seats up and hubby giggling and taking pictures.. grrrr
author: Annie L.

description: The lomo saltado entree is soooo good! For appetizer the mushroom and garlic appetizer is delicious the hubby and I literally scrape up every drop of sauce with the bread! I love this place it has a great mom and pop feel the food is good the portions are large my only complaint is that parking sucks but its sf what can you do.
author: Marianne Grace L.

description: i came here last night for my fave, peruvian food, and it was delish.  unlike fresca, destino, and limon, you don't come here for the scene but rather just good home cooking.  like seong said, we ordered way too much food, as portions were large.  i was really saltado-ed out, but we also got other great choices.  my fave was the paella marinara and the red snapper w/ tomato sauce.  we chose the one that was steamed, which was healthier, and you don't miss the butter at all.  i will definitely be back, b/c there are so many seafood choices, other than saltados.
author: Helen T.

description: Food portions are too small. Foods are ok( a bit too salt tho). Then environment is a bit too loud at night.
author: E L.

description: I've been dining at Mi Lindo Peru for years.  I concur with all the positive comment made about the restaurant and would like to add a few additional notes.   Carlos, the owner is always there and adds to the overall positive environment in this friendly little restaurant.  He will answer any questions you have about their dishes in a very comforting manner.  I love the Lomo *beefo)  or Pollo (chicken ) Saltado and would recommend it if you have not had Peruvian regional cuisine before.   Every meal starts off with a nice local bread and a wonderful spicy herb infused salsa.  It is spicy and goes on the bread and everything else.  Don't forget to order the Chicha Morado, the purple corn sweetened drink which is interesting and refreshing - It adds a perfect balance to salty dishes and the salsa.   Also, on their seafood plates, they sometimes serve a side of rice which is green with cilantro -  if  you are a cilantro lover, ask for this rice .    enjoy
author: Wilfred L.

description: My hubby and I have been wanting to try this place for the looonnnngest time and finally we went on a Saturday afternoon.  The yuca frita with cheese sauce was yummy! I got the loma a la pobre which was very generous in portion (had to take the rest home and made a second meal out it) and my hubby got a red snapper dish which he liked. The only drawback for me is that the prices were higher than I thought they were going to be.
author: Winnie L.

description: authentic, friendly and always good.  great place for a lively group after dancing at el rio!
author: A P.

description: I planned my birthday at Mi Lindo Peru and was highly pleased. Portions are huge for the price you pay and everything was delicious. My favorite was the steak with the plaintain. My friend loves the potatoes with the yellow creamy cheese. The restaurant is quite small so you have to make it there early to grab a table.
author: Christine N.

description: I was in the area and just happened to walk into the restaurant. Right as I walked in I was greeted with a friendly smile and quick service. The food was absolutely delicious! Portions were huge! I am not from the area but I would definitely go back or even order take out.
author: Gracie C.

description: i heart fries...and would you believe that's part of Peruvian cuisine? well i'm not sure if they are french fries or freedom fries for that matter but they are damn good in these traditional Peruvian dishes...yummy! i do heart mi lindo peru and i really should make the trek out to eat there more often
author: Paola W.

description:
was in the neighboorhood and figured I would try a random place.. peruvian food it will be.. this is only my second time having peruvian food..so, I don't have much expectations.. we looked at the other diners to get some ideas.. 

first the wait was quite a bit..then again it's a sunday night.. then it took a while for them to come by and take our orders ( a good 15 min went by)..the food had generous portions... I wish the service would be a little better.. they didn't come by our table..not until towards the end did they refill our water.. but, the food was good.. would go back..
author: Linda Y.

description: i agree with ian about the sangria price. that being said, they more than make up for that by giving you huge portions on everything. i've had several seafood dishes there, but i think they're pretty much known for their lomo saltado. if you live a block away like me, just drink your alcohol at home and then walk over.
author: Shinn Z.

description: i was drunk, but it didn't make me sick and it all tasted delicious!  nuff said.
author: Niki M.

description: i could say that i will be addicted to this place and peruvian food in general , fresca was always the spot to go , but after tryin mi lindo peru i think the real peruvian experience is there not at fresca , looking forward to go again , i heard inkas is good as well ,..
author: NAEL K.

description: this is the first place i ever ate peruvian food and i have to say this place is hella good i really like the lomo saltado and the arroz chaufa  i also tried a breaded steak once and it was really good the food here is great and you can,t go wrong at this place if you find yourself in the miission district and you want to try something diffrent check this place out.....
author: Jose C.

description: I lost my Peruvian food virginity one night here. She hit the spot. Her cold ceviche was infused with such a juicy and sour lime sauce that I didn't know how to react. I wasn't prepared for this. I had to react quickly. Fight or flee. I chose to eat. I detest sushi and all that is raw or rare in meats, and yet her ceviche seduced me like a 14 year old boy to Mary Kay Laturno. After that round, she fed me her succulant lomo saltado. One bite and I was hooked. No more lonely nights. This was the one. Fillet's of strip steak well-cooked to perfection along with fried plaintain's of the highest quality, neither too sweet nor salty. Next, I moved on to her beef pobre steak with fritas. Say that three times out loud. The only item I didn't like was her arroz con pollo. Maybe because she offered this to every other guy as her signature entree, it didn't really do it for me. Dry, like it had been let out to graze. Luckily, to top it all off, I had some of her seafood paella to round out my experience, infused with what tasted like Brazilian spices and Japanese soy sauce. Oooooo, I didn't know she was a mix. I visited her again with some new friends a month later and she gave me the best second round. I need to see her again! My Peruvian princess.
author: Chuck N.

description: A friend of mine recommended this place a while ago and I've returned several times.  My wife and I go here when we are particulary hungry because they give pretty substantial portions.  We haven't strayed far from what we had originally ordered (don't know the Peruvian names) because it was that good!  We always order that shrimp chowder (drool) which is so rich and full of flavor that we use the bread to sop up the bits we cannot pick up with our spoons (because licking the bowls would be embarrassing).  One order can feed 4 people easily, so bring some friends to restrain yourself from filling up too quickly.  We also order the frequently ordered chicken dish and ceviche.  And to wash it down, we get the sangria.  Just in case you have left over sangria (because we aren't big drinkers), ask for it to go.  It makes for a wonderful sauce when cooking beef.  Just  use it to deglaze the pan that you cooked your meat in, reduce it on a high flame, add a little salt and pepper, and there you have a wonderful sauce.
author: John L.

description: Awesome Lunch specials. I never leave hungry here... I often do not feel like going back to work after eating here. Yummy Lomo saltado!
author: Claudio P.

description: OK, this place is great. It's not Shalimar, but it's great just the same. We ordered both types of ceviche (just to cover all the bases) and they were superb. Fresh, with diverse flavors, not mushy and all mixed up, I wonder how they do that ? "Now calamari, you stay away from those shrimp while you're marinating together" who cares, it's great. Shrimp chowder was a bit rich for me, but amazing still. My companions had a mixed seafood soup and "Zarzuelo", another mixed seafood dish. Both looked satisfied and were full of praise. One thing, oh two things actually - one, the waitress dropped lots of stuff while we were there, one wine bottle (broke on the tile floor) and a plate of Peruvian spagetti (on a dude's lap), it was really entertaining, though I doubt she did it for our benefit. The second thing is that there was this guy in there who must have weighed 500 lbs, and there was some stuff growing on the back of his neck (I'm serious), that was entertaining too. OK, I'll come out and say it, this place -approaches- the goodness of Shalimar, without the pools of oil on top or the pigeons (ew !). Four stars on the first visit, maybe more next time.
author: Fattfreddie F.

description: Gave Mi Lindo Peru a try and came out a bit disappointed... probably because I totally got the wrong thing.  They bring you out soft bread and a spicy concoction to lather on top... good but hot!  We ordered some fried plantains and it's really hard to go wrong there... I'm a sucker.  I wanted something a little lighter so I tried a soup, which was full of calamari, clams, mussels, and white fish.  The cilantro broth was what really got me but when it came out, it just wasn't all that great.  The broth was a little too bland so the clams and mussels tasted fishy and it was overall pretty flavorless.  The little bro got the Lomo Saltado, which was a really tasty heap of seasoned sliced beef, onions, french fries, rice and tomatoes.  Probably should have done my Yelpwork beforehand.  The ambiance was also pretty non-existent, especially when they turned the music off b/c there were only 2 tables left in the joint.  No me pareci gran cosa... but with all the great reviews, I might give it another chance.
author: Tara G.

description: Not particularly standout Latin food but it is, in its own way, sort of reasonably priced comfort food. The choir preaches loudly about the Lomo Saltado and rightfully so...it can possibly be too much on a plate with a heap of onions and the strips of beef on a bed of rice. The mustard/ochre wall color highlights what may be a festive yet earthy dining atmosphere, but it was pretty quiet on a recent early evening visit. Their menu is basically seafood, steak, starches & sangria but upon closer inspection, one will find a vegetarian spaghetti dish that includes peas, carrots, mushrooms & onions and a few veggie plates on the tapas side. The tapas menu almost dwarfs the regular menu. The Mar y Tierra's ribeye is cooked to specs but my order turned out a little overdone, but still tender. The plate included a refreshing, zesty side of sliced onions & diced tomatoes, a few thick slices of fried potatoes and the nicely charred grilled prawns in a half shell. Nothing sensational, but it was all todos for me, hombre.
author: Chris C.

description: if by chance you find yourself frustrated because you cant get a table at limon or fresca check out mi lindo for equally comparable food. ceviche was fresh, saltado..was yummy especially with the fries - and i must warn you..careful on what you order because thier portions are HUGE -  advisable to share an entree when you order.
author: Christian S.

description: The food was great and the beer was ice cold. The ceviche de pescado was tart and spicy. The meat was perfect in the lomo saltado. The service was friendly. My only complaint is that they were out of the empanadas and don't appear to have aji de gallina on the menu at all.
author: Trick S.

description: this is one of my favorite places in the city.  the lomo saltado and fried plantains are some of my faves, and everything i have tried is excellent. i love topping it all off with a short walk to mitchell's ice cream for some yummy ice cream.
author: julia t.

description: good lomo ,but the rest was just not what i expected . The gambas,( fried shrimp) was so plane and with no flavor, the arroz con pollo too dry, the papa a la huancaina was just ok. no my fav place. but  the staff friendly and caring.
author: Karen P.

description: They cook seafood wonderfully - I will have to go back there with my friend whose mom came from "my beautiful Peru"... :)
author: T T.

description: Since the Grand Cafe got rid of its skirt steak, Mi Lindo Peru's bistec chorilliana (sp?), is my favorite steak in town.  Juicy, generous, oniony, with two perfectly fried little potato chunks on the side.  A steaming mass of rice that's perfectly done all the time.  It's awesome, more than awesome...  And all for the price of a Pomtini...  Go enough times and you'll be promoted to "caballero" status...
author: Sharif E.

description: small peruvian restaurant with good lomo saltado.  one of my most favorite dishes.  parking can be the biggest obsticle.  the service was great, very friendly and well organized.  i would definitly return to try out some other dishes and/or tapas.
author: Craig I.

description: Their lomo saltado is delicious!  HUGE servings. Couldn't finish my dish. Their ceviche was not to bad. Staff was friendly. Not a large place. When I hanker for Peruvian, I think Mi Lindo Peru.  Will try Inkas which is down the street next time just to see.
author: Linda H.

description: Love their Saltado, love the bread, butter and salsa, love the atmosphere, love there are few "middle-americans" talking so loud I can't think straight.  Service is always top of the line.  Portions are huge.  And the flavor in their Saltado is unbelievable.    They have great beer as well.
author: The P.

description: Service was really good but I've tried other Peruvian restaurants and this one was alright. I ordered the tallarin and the lady ordered the lomo saltado. I couldn't really pinpoint it, but it seemed like the dishes were missing something. Pricing was decent and of course the portions were pretty generous.
author: Glenn E.

description: This place rocks. Just went there for the first time with my husband and a couple of good friends who introduced us to Mi Lindo Peru. The sangria is EXCELLENT. I had the Pescado Saltado - scary that I ate the entire plateful of food. They are super generous with portions and the service is excellent - quick and friendly. We were seated very quickly, probably because we got there early, around 6:30p on a Saturday night. By about 7:30p or so, there was a line out the door on the sidewalk. It was a rainy wet night but people didn't seem to mind the wait. Excellent experience. We are looking for an excuse to go there again and leave the kids at home!
author: Jo A.

description: I heart this place...me and my hubby will find any excuse to go.  I will go here just for their delicious fried rice - I think the secret ingredient is crack, but who knows?  I really love all their tapas too. I usually go for that rather than an entree but my husband always gets the steak and he is forced to share.  Their yucca fries are great and its a meal that always pleases and is easy on the wallet.  The staff is friendly and their sangria does not skimp on the alcohol so be warned....eat more rice I say...
author: Kristina C.

description: Great little neighborhood restaurant serving good Peruvian food.
author: bong b.

description: Was new place to me but have had pervian food several time before. as my freind said in his review the decor was simple but the food was good. We had a ceviche Halibut wich was good. i split a a sangria withmy one freind. I had a seafood,fries and tomato and gravy dish I loved. also treid my freinds dish od shrimp chowder which i will get next time.  My best freind is from peru so he liked the dishes and ordered us a spiecal ice cream which we all shared. Looking forward to next time
author: Chris S.

description: Mi Lindo Peru was a great surprise in San Franciso.  The food was very good and I recommend the Sangria, you won't be sorry.  For the money, this was one of the best values I've found.
author: Barry W.

description: my fvorite peruvian restaurant, specialy lomo saltao, prijuela de mariscos, overall the food and the service is always excellent.
author: luis s.

description: I love the food there.  It tastes so good I wonder if there's any MSG in it.
author: sonoko k.

description: I read a review for Peruvian restaurants in the New York Times so I decided to try some.  I asked a friend and he recommended mi lindo peru.  My girlfriend and I visited this place on Friday and night and enjoyed it.  It is a quaint restaurant with seating for about 30 people.  We waited by the front door for 10 minutes for seating.  When we sat down the wait staff was very helpful and friendly, they even spoke spanish.  My girlfriend ordered the sangria, which I tried and I was pleasantly surprised.  It tasted mildly sweet, and even slightly bitter.  I liked it.  For appetizers we ordered the calamari and the salchipapas.  The calamari was average, slightly bland, I would have enjoyed more spices.  The salchipapas was excellent, hot dogs with fries.  The hot dogs were cooked differently from american hot dogs, similar to bacon.  For an entree we ordered lomo saltado.  The dish came with rice and fries, and I loved it.  The dish also came with tomatoes and onions and the meat was cooked perfectly with great spices.  We also ordered alfajaro for dessert and I enjoyed it.  It was caramel sandwiched between two cookies and coated with sugar.  The caramel was above average, but I think the cookies overrode the caramel.  Overall, I enjoyed the restaurant and the experience.  I would definitely return.
author: Kevin W.

description: although mi lindo peru doesn't have the best service, it's overpriced, and the complimentary bread is ten cent rolls from the mexican produce market, there is something great and intoxicating about this restaurant. the combination dim lighting, cramped tables, and too noisy cd's that skip every few seconds help to make this a wonderful dining experience. on top of all this, you never know exactly what you're ordering. somehow everytime i order something for the first time, when it gets to the table, it never looks like what i imagined it to. however, this isnt necessarily a bad thing. tried and true favorites include the sauteed garlic mushrooms (with cilantro, yum!), the chicken salad on top of the avocado slices, and my new all time favorite dinner, pescado saltado. pescado saltado is deep fried red snapper, white rice with little bits of corn, and homemade french fries. like morning after pizza, this dish is even better cold and eaten out of a to go box twelve hours later when all of the grease has settled in for added flavor.
author: Sushi K.
